Class GUIComponent

java.lang.Object
  Actor
      GUIComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Button, Label, TextField
public abstract class GUIComponent
extends Actor

A component is an object having a graphical representation that can be displayed on the screen and that can interact with the user. The GUIComponent class is the abstract superclass of components such as Button, Label and TextField. Class Component can be extended directly to create other components.

Version:
1.1 7/26/2011
Author:
Ed Parrish

Constructor Detail

GUIComponent

public GUIComponent()
Constructs a new component.

GUIComponent

public GUIComponent(String str)
Constructs a new component with the specified text. The component will not display until repaint() is called either directly or indirectly through calling a method like setFont().

Parameters:
str - The text to display on the component.

GUIComponent

public GUIComponent(String str,
                    Font f,
                    Color fg,
                    Color bg)
Constructs a new component setting the specified parameters. The component will not display until repaint() is called either directly or indirectly through calling a method like setFont().

Parameters:
str - The text to display on the component.
f - The font to use when displaying the text.
fg - The foreground color to use when displaying text.
bg - The background color of the component.

GUIComponent

public GUIComponent(String str,
                    Font f,
                    Color fg,
                    Color bg,
                    Border b)
Constructs a new component setting the specified parameters. The component will not display until repaint() is called either directly or indirectly through calling a method like setFont().

Parameters:
str - The text to display on the component.
f - The font to use when displaying the text.
fg - The foreground color to use when displaying text.
bg - The background color of this component.
b - The border to be rendered for this component.
Method Detail

act

public void act()
Default behavior for a component that implements the focus system. Override in subclasses for more specific behavior. However, call super.act() to allow focus changes.

setID

public void setID(int idNumber)
Set an ID number for this component.

Parameters:
idNumber - An identifier number.

getID

public int getID()
Return the ID number of this component.

Returns:
The ID number for this component.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean b)
Enables or disables the component, depending on the value of the parameter b. An enabled component can respond to user input and generate events. Components are enabled initially by default.

Parameters:
b - Set true to enable the component, otherwise false.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Determines whether this component is enabled. An enabled component can respond to user input and generate events. Components are enabled initially by default. A component may be enabled or disabled by calling its setEnabled() method.

Returns:
Returns true if the component is enabled, false otherwise.

setText

public void setText(String newText)
Set the text to be displayed.

Parameters:
newText - The new text to be displayed on this component.

getText

public String getText()
Returns the text for this component.

Returns:
The text displayed on this component.

setFont

public void setFont(Font newFont)
Set the font to use for writing the component text.

Parameters:
newFont - The font used to write on this component.

getFont

public Font getFont()
Returns the current font used by this component, or null if no font has been set.

Returns:
The current font or null if not font has been set.

setSize

public void setSize(Dimension d)
Resizes this component so that it has width d.width and height d.height.

Parameters:
d - The dimension specifying the new size.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns the current height of this component.

Returns:
The height of this component.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the current width of this component.

Returns:
The weight of this component.

isFixedSize

public boolean isFixedSize()
Determines whether this component is set to a fixed size. By default a component will determine its own size based on properties such as the text to display. However, the component can be set to a fixed size using the setSize() method.

Returns:
Returns true if the component is a fixed size; false otherwise.

setForeground

public void setForeground(Color fg)
Set the foreground color of this component, such as its text.

Parameters:
fg - The desired foreground color.

Returns:
The background color of this component.

setBorder

public void setBorder(Border newBorder)
Sets the border of this component. The Border object is responsible for defining the insets for the component and for rendering any border decorations.

Parameters:
newBorder - The border to be rendered for this component

getBorder

public Border getBorder()
Returns the border of this component or null if no border is currently set.

Returns:
the border object for this component

Returns a string representation of this component and its values.

A string representation of this component.

setFocusable

public void setFocusable(boolean canFocus)
Sets the focusable state of this GUIComponent to the specified value. This value overrides the component's default focusability.

Parameters:
canFocus - Determines whether this component is focusable.

isFocusable

public boolean isFocusable()
Returns whether this GUIComponent can receive focus.

Returns:
true if this GUIComponent is focusable; false otherwise.

requestFocus

public boolean requestFocus()
Requests that this component get the input focus. To receive focus, this component must be focusable and enabled. Developers must never assume that this component is the focus owner and must check the return value to be certain. If this method returns true then focus was received. If false is returned, the request failed.

Returns:
true if the focus succeeds and false if the focus fails.

isFocusOwner

public boolean isFocusOwner()
Returns true if this component is the focus owner.

Returns:
true if this component is the focus owner; false otherwise
Since:
1.4

wordWrap

public static String[] wordWrap(String str,
                                int max)
Wraps a single string into an array of strings for some maximum number of characters. Also will split lines on newlines or the characters "\n" allowing simple manually placed newlines.

Parameters:
str - The text to word wrap.
max - The maximum number of characters per line.
Returns:
The word-wrapped lines of text.

getTextDimension

public Dimension getTextDimension(String str,
                                  Graphics g)
Computes the dimension needed to display text in the specified Graphics context.

Parameters:
str - The text to display on this component.
g - The Graphics context in which to paint.
Returns:
the dimension (width and height) needed.

splitLines

public String[] splitLines(String str,
                           Graphics g)
Splits the text into multiple lines in the specified Graphics context. If the component size is fixed, then the text is word wrapped to fit. Otherwise, text is split on '\n' characters.

Parameters:
str - The text to display on this component.
g - The Graphics context in which to paint.
Returns:
the split lines of text.
